title: Drugs and Drug Classes
text: vignette showcases reported drugs drug classes PDSdatabase: many drug compounds listed reports many classes drugs listed reports many drugs classes drugs listed reports frequent drugs classes drugs listed reports across child development stages
code: library(PDSdatabase) library(rlang) library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(tidyr) library(stringr) library(ggplot2) library(ggthemes)  theme_set(     ggthemes::theme_tufte() + theme(text = element_text(size=16,face="bold")) ) download_sqlite_db() #downloads to current working directory

title: Drugs and Drug Classes
code: con <- connect_sqlite_db()

what: How many drug compounds are listed in reports?
title: Drugs and Drug Classes
text: field atc_concept_id concept adentifier drug’s ingredient encoded ATC vocabulary. number distinct drug ingredients compounds: number drug compounds across reports:
code: tbl(con,"ade_raw") %>%      distinct(atc_concept_id) %>%      count() ## # Source:   SQL [1 x 1] ## # Database: sqlite 3.39.4 [/home/runner/work/PDSdatabase/PDSdatabase/vignettes/effect_peds_19q2_v0.3_20211119.sqlite] ##       n ##   <int> ## 1  1088 tbl(con,"ade_raw") %>%      distinct(safetyreportid,atc_concept_id) %>%      group_by(safetyreportid) %>%      count(name = "Ndrugs") %>%      group_by(Ndrugs) %>%      count(name="Nreports") %>%      collect() %>%      ggplot(aes(Ndrugs,Nreports)) +     geom_bar(stat="identity",color="black",fill="gray") +     labs(x="Number of drugs listed in reports",          y="Number of reports") +     scale_y_continuous(trans="log10",labels=scales::comma)

what: How many classes of drugs are listed in reports?
title: Drugs and Drug Classes
code: tbl(con,"ade_raw") %>%      distinct(safetyreportid,            atc_concept_id) %>%      collect() %>%      inner_join(         tbl(con,"drug") %>%              distinct(atc_concept_id,atc1_concept_name) %>%              collect(),         by="atc_concept_id"     ) %>%      group_by(atc1_concept_name) %>%      summarise(         N = n_distinct(safetyreportid)     ) %>%      ggplot(aes(N,atc1_concept_name)) +     geom_bar(stat="identity",color="black",fill="gray") +     labs(x="Number of reports",y="")

what: What are the most frequent drugs and classes of drugs listed in reports across child development stages?
title: Drugs and Drug Classes
code: scale_y_reordered <- function(..., sep = "___") {   reg <- paste0(sep, ".+$")   ggplot2::scale_y_discrete(labels = function(x) gsub(reg, "", x), ...) }  reorder_within <- function(x, by, within, fun = mean, sep = "___", ...) {   new <- paste(x, within, sep = sep)   stats::reorder(new, by, FUN = fun) }  drug_tbl <-      tbl(con,"drug") %>%      distinct(atc_concept_id,atc_concept_name,              !!!rlang::syms(paste0("atc",1:4,"_concept_name"))              ) %>%      collect() %>%      rename(atc5_concept_name = atc_concept_name) %>%      pivot_longer(         cols=paste0("atc",1:5,"_concept_name"),         names_to = "atc_class",         values_to = "value"     )   drug_tbl ## # A tibble: 5,440 × 3 ##    atc_concept_id atc_class         value                                        ##             <int> <chr>             <chr>                                        ##  1        1588648 atc1_concept_name CARDIOVASCULAR SYSTEM                        ##  2        1588648 atc2_concept_name AGENTS ACTING ON THE RENIN-ANGIOTENSIN SYST… ##  3        1588648 atc3_concept_name ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs), CO… ##  4        1588648 atc4_concept_name Angiotensin II receptor blockers (ARBs), ot… ##  5        1588648 atc5_concept_name valsartan and sacubitril                     ##  6        1588697 atc1_concept_name RESPIRATORY SYSTEM                           ##  7        1588697 atc2_concept_name OTHER RESPIRATORY SYSTEM PRODUCTS            ##  8        1588697 atc3_concept_name OTHER RESPIRATORY SYSTEM PRODUCTS            ##  9        1588697 atc4_concept_name Other respiratory system products            ## 10        1588697 atc5_concept_name ivacaftor and lumacaftor                     ## # … with 5,430 more rows

previous_headings: What are the most frequent drugs and classes of drugs listed in reports across child development stages?
title: Drugs and Drug Classes
code: tmp <- tbl(con,"ade_raw") %>%      distinct(safetyreportid,            atc_concept_id) %>%      collect() %>%      inner_join(         drug_tbl,         by="atc_concept_id"     ) %>%      group_by(value) %>%      summarise(         Nreports = n_distinct(safetyreportid)         ) %>%      inner_join(         drug_tbl %>%              distinct(atc_class,value),         by="value"     ) %>%      arrange(desc(Nreports)) %>%      group_by(atc_class) %>%      slice_head(n=10)  tmp %>%      ggplot(aes(Nreports,reorder_within(value,Nreports,atc_class))) +     geom_bar(stat="identity") +     scale_y_reordered() +     facet_wrap(~atc_class,ncol=1,scales="free_y") +     xlab("Number of safety reports from birth through 21 years old") +     ylab("")

previous_headings: What are the most frequent drugs and classes of drugs listed in reports across child development stages?

title: Adverse Events and Classes
text: vignette showcases reported adverse events event classes PDSdatabase: many adverse listed reports many classes events listed reports many adverse events classes events listed reports frequent adverse events classes events listed reports across child development stages

title: Getting Started
text: main thesis behind published resource children adverse events drug exposure just disease process also biological processes growth development. National Institute Child Human Development defines 7 stages child development estimate signals: term neonate (0-27 days), infancy (28 days-1 years), toddler (1 year-2 years), early childhood (2-5 years), middle childhood (6-11 years), early adolescence 12-17 years, late adolescence (18-21 years). database contains tables drug safety signals drug, adverse event, biological ontologies facilitate teasing apart influences contributions adverse drug events childhood.

title: Getting Started
text: package helps identifying, retrieving, loading database. Retrieve database: Connect database: something:  labelled numbers number observed drug reports adverse event. red bars intervals estimated signal drug exposure’s effect occurrence adverse event child development stage. context, risk signal estimate synonymous - use risk model generate drug safety signals. Disconnect database: much can done data found database. Stay tuned vignettes!
code:
library(PDSdatabase) download_sqlite_db() #downloads to current working directory con <- connect_sqlite_db() library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2) library(tidyr) library(stringr)  drug_ <- "montelukast; oral" event_ <- "Nightmare"  theme_big <-    theme_classic(base_size=16) +    theme(     strip.text = element_text(color="black",face="bold"),     strip.background = element_blank(),     axis.title.x = element_blank(),     axis.line = element_blank(),     axis.ticks = element_blank(),     axis.text.x = element_text(color="black",face="bold",                                angle=45,vjust=1,hjust=1),     axis.text.y = element_blank(),     axis.title.y = element_text(color="black",face="bold"),     legend.position = "top",     legend.text = element_text(color="black",face="bold"),     legend.key.size = unit(0.4,"cm"),     legend.box.margin = margin(-0.4,-0.4,0,-0.4,unit = "cm")   )  stages <-   c("term_neonatal","infancy",     "toddler","early_childhood",     "middle_childhood","early_adolescence",     "late_adolescence") stages_split <- str_replace(stages,"_","
")  plot_ade_risks <- function(x,color="red",theme=theme_big,ts=5){   x$nichd_split <- str_replace(x$nichd,"_","
")   x$NICHD = factor(x$nichd_split,levels=str_replace(stages,"_","
"))   x %>%      ggplot(aes(factor(nichd_split,levels=stages_split),gam_score,group=ade)) +     geom_bar(stat="identity",aes(y=log10(as.numeric(DE)+1)),fill="lightgray",color="black") +     ggrepel::geom_label_repel(       aes(         label=DE,         y=log10(as.numeric(DE)+1)       ),       vjust=1.3,fontface="bold",size=ts) +     geom_point(color=color,size=2) +     geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=gam_score_90mse,ymax=gam_score_90pse),                   width=0.1,color=color,size=1) +     geom_hline(yintercept = 0,color="black",size=0.5) +     facet_wrap(~ade_name,labeller = label_wrap_gen(width = 20)) +     xlab("") +     ylab("Risk of ADE (GAM log odds)") +      theme +     theme(       axis.line = element_line(),       axis.ticks = element_line(),       axis.text.y = element_text(color="black",face="bold",size=12)     )    }  tbl(con,"ade_nichd") %>%      filter(ade_name==paste0(drug_," and ",event_)) %>%      collect() %>%      plot_ade_risks() ## Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. ## ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. disconnect_sqlite_db(con)

title: Most likely ADE at child develpment stages
text: vignette quantifies likely ADEs occur development stages using dGAM statistics. method quantifies safety signal (select covariate-adjustment) every ADE development stages independently. vignette shows estimate likely ADE stage given ADEs occur multiple stages childood. text: Nicholas Giangreco. Maintainer.

text: Giangreco N (2022). PDSdatabase: Download Connect PDSdatabase. https://github.com/ngiangre/PDSdatabase, http://nickg.bio/PDSdatabase/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PDSdatabase: Download and Connect to the PDSdatabase},   author = {Nicholas Giangreco},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/ngiangre/PDSdatabase, http://nickg.bio/PDSdatabase/}, }

title: Download and Connect to the PDSdatabase
text: R data package contains observation, summary, model-level data pediatric drug safety research developed Nicholas Giangreco PhD dissertation Tatonetti lab Columbia University. database comprised 17 tables including table descriptions fields table. main table, ade_nichd, contains quantitative data nearly 500,000 pediatric drug safety signals across 7 child development stages spanning birth late adolescence (21 years age). database created using methods analyses references. Final paper coming soon! data resource can used MIT license agreement.

title: Download and Connect to the PDSdatabase
text: Adverse drug reactions leading cause morbidity mortality costs billions dollars healthcare system. children, increased risk adverse drug reactions potentially lasting adverse effects adulthood. current pediatric drug safety landscape, including clinical trials, limited rarely includes children relies extrapolation adults. Children small adults go evolutionarily conserved physiologically dynamic process growth maturation. hypothesize adverse drug reactions manifest interaction drug exposure dynamic biological processes child growth development. hypothesize developing statistical methodologies prior knowledge dynamic, shared information development, can improve detection adverse drug events children. data package downloads SQLite database created applying covariate-adjusted disproportionality generalized additive models (dGAMs) systematic way develop resource nearly half million adverse drug event (ADE) risk estimates across child development stages.

title: Download and Connect to the PDSdatabase
text: observation-level data, case reports drug(s) potentially linked adverse event(s), collected Food Drug Administration Adverse Event System (FAERS) US. data publicly available openFDA platform downloadable json files. However, utilizing data -non-trivial, drug event report data published chunks nested json structure quarter per year since 1990s. API key extended permissions, developed custom python notebooks scripts available ‘openFDA_drug_event-parsing’ github repository (DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4464544) extract format drug event reports prior third quarter 2019. observation-level data used, called Pediatric FAERS, downstream analyses stored table ade_raw.

title: Download and Connect to the PDSdatabase
text: drugs adverse events reported coded standard, hierarchical vocabularies. Adverse events standardized Medical Dictionary Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) vocabulary (details hierarcy founds ). Drugs standardized Anatomical Therapeutic Class (ATC) vocabulary (details found ). reporting adverse events drugs can dependent disease context report’s subject. represented summarizing number drugs therapeutic class report.

title: Download and Connect to the PDSdatabase
text: invented disproportionality generalized additive model (dGAM) method detecting adverse drug events spontaneous reports. applied logistic generalized additive model unique drug-event pairs Pediatric FAERS. drug-event GAM used quantify adverse event risk due drug exposure versus exposure across child development stages. Please see references full specification details GAM.

title: Download and Connect to the PDSdatabase
text: PDSdatabase R package downloads sqlite database local machine connects database using DBI R package. novel data resource half million pediatric drug safety signals across growth development stages. Please see references details data fields code repository paper.

title: Download and Connect to the PDSdatabase
code: #remotes::install_github("ngiangre/PDSdatabase") library(PDSdatabase)

title: Download and Connect to the PDSdatabase
code: library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr'  ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag  ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union if(!("effect_peds_19q2_v0.3_20211119.sqlite" %in% list.files())){     PDSdatabase::download_sqlite_db() }  con <- PDSdatabase::connect_sqlite_db()  DBI::dbListTables(con) ##  [1] "ade"                                            ##  [2] "ade_nichd"                                      ##  [3] "ade_nichd_enrichment"                           ##  [4] "ade_null"                                       ##  [5] "ade_null_distribution"                          ##  [6] "ade_raw"                                        ##  [7] "atc_raw_map"                                    ##  [8] "cyp_gene_expression_substrate_risk_information" ##  [9] "dictionary"                                     ## [10] "drug"                                           ## [11] "drug_gene"                                      ## [12] "event"                                          ## [13] "gene"                                           ## [14] "gene_expression"                                ## [15] "grip"                                           ## [16] "ryan"                                           ## [17] "sider" dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::collect() ## # A tibble: 152 × 4 ##    table field             description                                     type  ##    <chr> <chr>             <chr>                                           <chr> ##  1 drug  atc_concept_id    The ATC 5th level OMOP concept identifier.      int   ##  2 drug  atc_concept_name  The ATC 5th level OMOP concept name. In the ad… char… ##  3 drug  atc_concept_code  The ATC 5th level OMOP concept code.            char… ##  4 drug  ndrugreports      The number of reports of the drug in Pediatric… int   ##  5 drug  atc4_concept_name The ATC 4th level OMOP concept name.            char… ##  6 drug  atc4_concept_code The ATC 4th level OMOP concept code.            char… ##  7 drug  atc3_concept_name The ATC 3rd level OMOP concept name.            char… ##  8 drug  atc3_concept_code The ATC 3rd level OMOP concept code.            char… ##  9 drug  atc2_concept_name The ATC 2nd level OMOP concept name.            char… ## 10 drug  atc2_concept_code The ATC 2nd level OMOP concept code.            char… ## # … with 142 more rows dplyr::tbl(con,"ade_nichd") %>%      dplyr::collect() ## # A tibble: 3,225,859 × 13 ##    atc_c…¹ meddr…² ade   nichd gam_s…³  norm gam_s…⁴ gam_s…⁵ gam_s…⁶     D     E ##      <int>   <int> <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <int> <int> ##  1 1588648  3.58e7 1588… term…  -0.131 0        2.48 -4.21      3.95     0    20 ##  2 1588648  3.58e7 1588… infa…   0.947 0.166    1.98 -2.31      4.21     0    80 ##  3 1588648  3.58e7 1588… todd…   2.03  0.332    1.79 -0.923     4.98     0   107 ##  4 1588648  3.58e7 1588… earl…   3.11  0.499    1.86  0.0553    6.17     0   294 ##  5 1588648  3.58e7 1588… midd…   4.21  0.667    2.10  0.745     7.67     0  1046 ##  6 1588648  3.58e7 1588… earl…   5.30  0.834    2.52  1.15      9.44     1  2697 ##  7 1588648  3.58e7 1588… late…   6.38  1        3.14  1.21     11.5      0  1729 ##  8 1588648  3.63e7 1588… term…  -0.310 0        5.61 -9.53      8.91     0     0 ##  9 1588648  3.63e7 1588… infa…   2.25  0.166    4.43 -5.05      9.54     0     2 ## 10 1588648  3.63e7 1588… todd…   4.81  0.332    3.79 -1.43     11.1      0     6 ## # A tibble: 460,823 × 9 ##    ade           atc_c…¹ meddr…² clust…³ gt_nu…⁴ gt_nu…⁵ max_s…⁶ clust…⁷ ade_n…⁸ ##    <chr>           <int>   <int> <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ##  1 1588648_3580… 1588648  3.58e7 2             1       0 late_a… Increa… 1       ## what: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
text: Thus function downloads database published Giangreco et al. 2022.

title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
code: download_sqlite_db(   url = "https://pds-database.s3.amazonaws.com/effect_peds_19q2_v0.3_20211119.sqlite",   path = "./",   destfile = paste0(path, "effect_peds_19q2_v0.3_20211119.sqlite"),   method = "auto",   quiet = TRUE,   timeout = 360 )

title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
text: url url sqlite database path path dump sqlite database. destfile path filename dump sqlite database. See download.file method method download sqlite database. See download.file quiet Whether download quietly. See download.file timeout Extended download session downloading tihs file. Default 360 seconds.

title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
text: TRUE, invisibly
